# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    return @chain df begin
        |> select(DateTime => ByRow(date -> string(date.value.year, date.value.month)))
        |> transform(new_column = :ym, yyyyMM => ByRow(v -> parse(Int64, v, base=10)))
    end
end
```

This function selects the `DateTime` column from the DataFrame and applies a row-wise operation to extract the year and month components. It then transforms the result into a new column `ym` by parsing the string representation of the year and month into an integer in the format "yyyymm" using Base.parse with a specified base 10.
